item.title: Bypassing ASLR and DEP for 32-Bit Binaries With r2
item.description: This post covers basic basics of bypassing ASLR and DEP with r2. For this, a vulnerable application, yolo.c, is required: #include <stdio.h> #include <stdlib.h> #include <string.h> void lol(char *b) { char buffer[1337]; strcpy(buffer, b); } int main(int argc, char **argv) { lol(argv[1]); } 64-Bit vs 32-Bit Binaries The issue here should be quite obvious - strcpy blindly copies the user-controlled input buffer b into buffer which causes a buffer overflow.
